1. President Biden’s proposed stimulus package includes additional direct payments of up to ___ for most Americans.
  • $600
  • $1,200
  • $1,400
  • $2,000
That's correct.
That's incorrect.

On January 14, then-President-elect Biden unveiled his $1.9 trillion stimulus proposal. The plan includes a $1,400 check for most Americans, which, combined with the $600 payments passed in December, would bring the total relief to $2,000.

2. True or false: On January 20, stocks had their best Inauguration Day performance in several decades.
  • True
  • False
That's correct.
That's incorrect.
All three indexes closed at record highs on January 20, the day of President Biden’s inauguration. The Dow rose 0.8%, the S&P 500 1.4%, and the Nasdaq 2%. It was the S&P and Nasdaq’s best Inauguration Day performance since Reagan started his second term in 1985.
3. President Biden signed an executive order extending the pause on federal student loans until the end of which month?
  • March
  • July
  • September
  • December
That's correct.
That's incorrect.
The pause on student loans was set to expire at the end of this month, but President Biden signed an executive order extending it to September.
4. President Biden signed an executive order raising the minimum wage for:
  • All Americans
  • Workers in areas with a high cost of living
  • Federal government employees
  • Federal and state government employees
That's correct.
That's incorrect.
On January 22, President Biden signed an executive order clearing a path for all federal employees to receive a minimum wage of $15 per hour. His stimulus proposal includes a provision to raise the federal minimum wage to the same level, but that can’t be done without the approval of Congress.
5. Janet Yellen was recently confirmed by the Senate to become the first woman to serve as secretary of which department?
  • State
  • Treasury
  • Defense
  • Commerce
That's correct.
That's incorrect.
Janet Yellen, who was the first woman to lead the Federal Reserve, was sworn in as the first female Treasury secretary on Monday, January 25.
You got _ out of 5 right.
